body_html:
No one else should call _norm from outside this module... Does anyone?
…
On Sep 17, 2017 9:40 AM, "Maximilian Bachl" ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/rnn_cell.py <#12209 (comment)> : > @@ -1303,24 +1303,25 @@ def state_size(self): def output_size(self): return self._num_units - def _norm(self, inp, scope): + def _norm(self, inp, scope, dtype=dtypes.float32): No, you don't need it but in case some legacy code calls _norm directly – for whatever reason – the default argument prevents this code from breaking. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
No one else should call _norm from outside this module... Does anyone?
…
On Sep 17, 2017 9:40 AM, "Maximilian Bachl" ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/rnn_cell.py
 <#12209 (comment)>
 :

 > @@ -1303,24 +1303,25 @@ def state_size(self):
    def output_size(self):
      return self._num_units

 -  def _norm(self, inp, scope):
 +  def _norm(self, inp, scope, dtype=dtypes.float32):

 No, you don't need it but in case some legacy code calls _norm directly –
 for whatever reason – the default argument prevents this code from breaking.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#12209 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim38RuWEV-z0Dx8SGawkg-QP8qf89ks5sjUtxgaJpZM4O0ckU>
 .
body:
No one else should call _norm from outside this module... Does anyone?

On Sep 17, 2017 9:40 AM, "Maximilian Bachl" <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@muxamilian* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/rnn_cell.py
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12209#discussion_r139315193>
> :
>
> > @@ -1303,24 +1303,25 @@ def state_size(self):
>    def output_size(self):
>      return self._num_units
>
> -  def _norm(self, inp, scope):
> +  def _norm(self, inp, scope, dtype=dtypes.float32):
>
> No, you don't need it but in case some legacy code calls _norm directly –
> for whatever reason – the default argument prevents this code from breaking.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
